page.title: 07Ecology in Pencombe
page.content: In the past little thought seems to have been given to ecology. Nowadays we are very much aware of the importance of retaining what we have. Hedges are less frequently torn up to create larger fields and we are encouraged to leave plots of land uncultivated to give nature a chance. More effort is now made to retain the beauty of the countryside. There is still plenty of wildlife around us and seen recently are otters, badgers, foxes, hares, rabbits, stoats, weasels, moles, rats and various mice and voles. Birdlife is abundant. Care taken not to pollute ground and surface water means that fish, frogs and newts (local dialect: adzels) are to be found in the stream in Pencombe. Trees are preserved wherever possible and replaced when felled.
